intro: Cebatha villosa, commonly known as the hairy cebatha, is a flowering plant native to certain regions of South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features hairy stems and leaves, which give it its common name and help in reducing water loss. Its flowers typically bloom in the spring and summer, producing small, yellowish blooms that attract pollinators. Cebatha villosa is often found in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky areas.
